verses.name: Proverbs 22:1
verses.text: A good name is rather to be chosen than great riches, and loving favour rather than silver and gold.

verses.name: Proverbs 22:2
verses.text: The rich and poor meet together: the Lord is the maker of them all.

verses.name: Proverbs 22:3
verses.text: A prudent man foreseeth the evil, and hideth himself: but the simple pass on, and are punished.

verses.name: Proverbs 22:4
verses.text: By humility and the fear of the Lord are riches, and honour, and life.

verses.name: Proverbs 22:5
verses.text: Thorns and snares are in the way of the froward: he that doth keep his soul shall be far from them.

verses.name: Proverbs 22:6
verses.text: Train up a child in the way he should go: and when he is old, he will not depart from it.

verses.name: Proverbs 22:7
verses.text: The rich ruleth over the poor, and the borrower is servant to the lender.

verses.name: Proverbs 22:8
verses.text: He that soweth iniquity shall reap vanity: and the rod of his anger shall fail.

verses.name: Proverbs 22:9
verses.text: He that hath a bountiful eye shall be blessed; for he giveth of his bread to the poor.

verses.name: Proverbs 22:10
verses.text: Cast out the scorner, and contention shall go out; yea, strife and reproach shall cease.

verses.name: Proverbs 22:11
verses.text: He that loveth pureness of heart, for the grace of his lips the king shall be his friend.

verses.name: Proverbs 22:12
verses.text: The eyes of the Lord preserve knowledge, and he overthroweth the words of the transgressor.

verses.name: Proverbs 22:13
verses.text: The slothful man saith, There is a lion without, I shall be slain in the streets.

verses.name: Proverbs 22:14
verses.text: The mouth of strange women is a deep pit: he that is abhorred of the Lord shall fall therein.

verses.name: Proverbs 22:15
verses.text: Foolishness is bound in the heart of a child; but the rod of correction shall drive it far from him.

verses.name: Proverbs 22:16
verses.text: He that oppresseth the poor to increase his riches, and he that giveth to the rich, shall surely come to want.

verses.name: Proverbs 22:17
verses.text: Bow down thine ear, and hear the words of the wise, and apply thine heart unto my knowledge.

verses.name: Proverbs 22:18
verses.text: For it is a pleasant thing if thou keep them within thee; they shall withal be fitted in thy lips.

verses.name: Proverbs 22:19
verses.text: That thy trust may be in the Lord, I have made known to thee this day, even to thee.

verses.name: Proverbs 22:20
verses.text: Have not I written to thee excellent things in counsels and knowledge,

verses.name: Proverbs 22:21
verses.text: That I might make thee know the certainty of the words of truth; that thou mightest answer the words of truth to them that send unto thee?

verses.name: Proverbs 22:22
verses.text: Rob not the poor, because he is poor: neither oppress the afflicted in the gate:

verses.name: Proverbs 22:23
verses.text: For the Lord will plead their cause, and spoil the soul of those that spoiled them.

verses.name: Proverbs 22:24
verses.text: Make no friendship with an angry man; and with a furious man thou shalt not go:

verses.name: Proverbs 22:25
verses.text: Lest thou learn his ways, and get a snare to thy soul.

verses.name: Proverbs 22:26
verses.text: Be not thou one of them that strike hands, or of them that are sureties for debts.

verses.name: Proverbs 22:27
verses.text: If thou hast nothing to pay, why should he take away thy bed from under thee?

verses.name: Proverbs 22:28
verses.text: Remove not the ancient landmark, which thy fathers have set.

verses.name: Proverbs 22:29
verses.text: Seest thou a man diligent in his business? he shall stand before kings; he shall not stand before mean men.
